{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to Document [2], the risk of HIV transmission from infected mothers to their children is 15% to 30% during gestation or labour. Document [7] also states that without anti-retroviral treatment, the risk of HIV transmission from infected mothers to their children is 15-30% during gestation or labour. Document [11] also states that in the absence of treatment, the risk of transmission before or during birth is around 15% to 30%. Therefore, the percentage of mother to child transmission of HIV during delivery without intervention in a non-breast fed child is 15-30%.", "answer_choice": "C"}
